title: Create Regional Association Plots
text: goal locusplotr allow users integrate genome-wide association study results linkage disequilibrium data create regional association plots surrounding genomic locus interest. gg_locusplot function allows user provide GWAS summary statistics region interest reference/sentinel/lead variant within region, return ggplot object regional association plot. background, package uses helper function named ld_extract_locuszoom query University Michigan LocusZoom API (https://portaldev.sph.umich.edu/) obtain linkage disequilibrium data genetic variant genomic region interest (allowing user specify genome build genetic ancestry).

title: Create Regional Association Plots
text: can install locusplotr GitHub:

title: Create Regional Association Plots
text: Start dataframe containing genome wide association study summary statistics locus interest Use gg_locusplot function create regional association plot. calls ld_extract_locuszoom function background fetch linkage disequilibrium data University Michigan LocusZoom API (https://portaldev.sph.umich.edu/).  Use plot_genes argument include plot genes within region beneath main regional association plot.  Use plot_recombination argument include secondary axis containing recombination rates regional association plot.  Additional arguments allow user specify genome build (GRCh37, GRCH38), population (Eg. , AMR, AFR, EUR, EAS, etc.), plot title/subtitle, directory save regional association plot .pdf. ld_extract_locuszoom function, called background gg_locusplot, can also used retrieve linkage disequilibrium data genetic variant genomic region interest. user may specify genome build, population, specific linkage disequilibrium metric (Eg. r, rsquare, cov)

title: Create a regional association plot — gg_locusplot
text: Returns ggplot object containing regional association plot (-log10(p-value) function chromosomal position, variants colored linkage disequilibrium reference variant). function allows user integrate genome wide association study (GWAS) summary statistics locus interest linkage disequilibrium information (obtained using University Michigan LocusZoom API https://portaldev.sph.umich.edu/) locus create regional association plot.

title: Create a regional association plot — gg_locusplot
code: gg_locusplot(   df,   lead_snp = NULL,   rsid = rsid,   chrom = chrom,   pos = pos,   ref = ref,   alt = alt,   effect = NULL,   std_err = NULL,   p_value = p_value,   trait = NULL,   plot_pvalue_threshold = 0.1,   plot_subsample_prop = 0.25,   plot_distance = 5e+05,   genome_build = "GRCh37",   population = "ALL",   plot_genes = FALSE,   plot_recombination = FALSE,   plot_title = NULL,   plot_subtitle = NULL,   path = NULL )

title: Create a regional association plot — gg_locusplot
text: df Dataframe containing columns rsid, chromosome, position, reference/effect allele, alternate/non-effect allele, p-value variants within range interest lead_snp character vector containing lead variant interest. NULL (default), variant lowest p-value selected lead variant. rsid Rsid column chrom Chromosome column pos Position column ref Reference/effect allele column alt Alternate/non-effect allele column effect Effect size column (beta log-odds scale) std_err Standard error column p_value P-value column trait (optional) Column containing name trait plot_pvalue_threshold Threshold plotting p-value regional association plot (default = 0.1) - reducing number points decreases file size improves performance plot_subsample_prop Proportion points p-value threshold plot (default = 0.25; range = 0-1) - reducing number points decreases file size improves performance plot_distance Integer corresponding size locus plotted genome_build Character - one "GRCh37" "GRCh38" population Character - one "", "AFR", "AMR", "EAS", "EUR", "SAS" referring reference population interest obtaining linkage disequilibrium information (default = "") plot_genes Logical - Include plot genes/transcripts within region interest beneath regional association plot (default = FALSE) plot_recombination Logical - Include secondary y-axis recombination rate within region interest plot_title character string corresponding plot title (default = NULL) plot_subtitle character string corresponding plot subtitle (default = NULL) path Character string (default = NULL) - path supplied .pdf plot saved
